resources.string: Please keep your phone out of the charger and try to not use it during the entire benchmark.

The benchmark starts a foreground service with a wake lock and schedules repetitive tasks on the main thread (every 10s), a custom thread executor (every 10s) and schedules regular alarms using AlarmManager.setExactAndAllowWhileIdle (every 10 minutes). Then it calculates the score by comparing executed vs. expected.

Scores close to 100% are good results - non-standard battery optimizations are not applied at the moment. Although it is good to repeat the test in a week as some OEMs may apply limits to apps which are not used for a while.

THE GRAPH

Each row in the graph represents 5 minutes. Ideally you see 30 circles and triangles on each line and one square every second line. Larger regions of white-space indicate a problem - your apps may not work as intended if you won't change your phone's settings.

\For more details check the apps code at https://github.com/urbandroid-team/dontkillmy-app
DontKillMyApp Benchmark checks your phone background processing to make apps on your phone work properly.\n\nhttps://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.urbandroid.dontkillmyapp

We want to make apps work even on phones whose manufacturers prefer battery over functionality.

The best way you can help make this project visible is to rate and comment this free and open source tool on the Play Store.

Many thanks for helping us making the Android eco-system a better place!
